newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia coffee prices stable, interest thin.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia coffee prices stable, interest thin.

text.p: Indonesian Robusta coffee prices were generally stable on Monday from a week ago on post-harvest supply tightness while buyers stayed sidelined, traders said.

The local price was quoted unchanged from last week's 2,650-2,700 rupiah/kg in the key growing region of Lampung in South Sumatra. The export price was marginally down at $1,200-$1,210/tonne fob Lampung from $1,210-$1,220/tonne.

"Buyers are showing little interest because local prices are at a premium to Vietnam's," one trader said. "Vietnamese prices are up to $100/tonne lower than the local export price. How can we compete with such a big discount in prices."

Traders said tight supply following the end of the coffee season in September was expected to keep local prices stable through the week, adding that farmers would hold back sales if prices trend downwards.
"They (farmers) know that there is little coffee left in the market. If prices go down, they will rather hold back than sell cheap," one trader said.
Traders said they expected London coffee futures to open unchanged to slightly down later on Monday. "London will open unchanged to maybe $5 down," one trader said.
